title: Simple circuits - lit bulbs in circuits 1 and 2

content.question: Two circuits, Circuit <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Circuit <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are shown in the figure. Each switch in the two circuits is either open or closed, as indicated. Which of the following correctly relates the numbers <math alttext="N sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="N sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> of lightbulbs that are lit in circuits <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="N sub 1, is greater than, N sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="N sub 2, is greater than, N sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="N sub 1, equals, N sub 2, which equals, 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="N sub 1, equals, N sub 2, which is greater than, 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="N sub 1, is greater than, N sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
